title: Design and Application of Cognitive Load Theory-Based Workshops for Healthcare Professionals

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Medical Knowledge and Clinical Practice Experience
context.additional_context: Course designed for medical professionals to systematically analyze and resolve complex clinical scenarios through project-based learning. Flexible learning environments utilizing personal devices

learning_goals: Learners can apply the three elements of cognitive load theory (intrinsic, extraneous, germane load) to actual clinical cases.
Learners can design a process for systematically categorizing complex medical information and transforming it into educational materials.
Learners can propose workshop improvements incorporating peer feedback and self-reflection through project-based assessment methods.

resources: Digital Collaboration Tools (Google Workspace, Miro, etc.)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
